intro: Sisyrinchium furcatum, commonly known as the forked blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and showy, blue-to-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a splash of color to arid landscapes. Sisyrinchium furcatum is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
